oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tandy Rice Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1978 Side One
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Tandy Rice. The recording takes place on 8-18-78.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tandy Rice
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:04) -- Bob Allen introduction about his article on Top Billing. (0:46) -- Bob Allen asks about the first agencies Tandy Rice worked for. (2:40) -- Tandy Rice discusses starting out working as a publicist. (4:23) -- Tandy Rice about the relationship between agents and artists. (5:17) -- Tandy Rice on the "agency explosion." (6:59) -- Tandy Rice describes that a publicity department of a company reflects the company's character. (9:02) -- Tandy Rice mentions that he went into business for himself as a publicist for five years. (9:19) -- Tandy Rice was offered a job by Showbiz Incorporated, Bill Graham. (10:30) -- Tandy Rice describes being trained by Bill Graham. (12:41) -- Tandy Rice speaks about Showbiz Incorporated growing into a "General Motors of the TV industry." (13:12) -- Tandy Rice speaks about Bill Graham starting Top Billing incorporated. His first client was Porter Wagoner. (16:07) -- Tandy Rice tells the story of how he bought Top Billing. (18:00) -- Tandy Rice introduces his nephew to Bob Allen. (20:18) -- Interview continues, Tandy Rice tells a story about going into debt for the first time. (22:45) -- Tandy Rice speaks about the beginnings of the Top Billing offices. (23:20) -- Bob Allen asks how Tandy Rice maintained Top Billing's clientele. (26:41) -- Bob Allen asks how many people Tandy Rice currently represents. (26:55) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice what the future of Top Billing looks like. (28:30) -- Tandy Rice wants his own building for Top Billing and a west coast specialist. (29:36) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice to define management. (32:52) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about the importance of artist management. (34:56) -- Tandy Rice speaks about an artist managing themselves. (36:26) -- Tandy Rice explains his opinion on a story written by Bob Allen. (37:28) -- Tandy Rice speaks about the Nashville agency scene. (39:30) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about the technology used in his business. (40:33) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about the Philadelphia marketplace. (41:51) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice to describe the international marketplace. (43:30) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about whether the national market's potential has been fully unlocked. (44:27) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about the business factor and relevance of television.
